meanings.definition: The act of cutting and polishing a gemstone to create multiple flat surfaces
meanings.sent1: The facetting of the diamond made it sparkle in the light.
meanings.sent2: Jewelers use facetting to enhance the beauty of gemstones.
meanings.sent3: The facetting of the gemstone was so precise, it seemed to dance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her skillful facetting of the gem turned it into a dazzling masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The facetting process transformed the rough stone into a brilliant jewel.

meanings.definition: The process of dividing a geometric shape into smaller shapes
meanings.sent1: Mathematicians use facetting to break down complex shapes into simpler ones.
meanings.sent2: The facetting of the shape helped in calculating its area more accurately.
meanings.sent3: The facetting of the triangle turned it into a puzzle for the students.
meanings.sent4: The facetting of the square revealed its hidden patterns.
meanings.sent5: Through facetting, the shape was deconstructed into manageable parts.

meanings.definition: The act of highlighting or emphasizing certain aspects or features of something
meanings.sent1: The facetting of her argument brought clarity to the discussion.
meanings.sent2: In storytelling, facetting can draw attention to key plot points.
meanings.sent3: His facetting of the painting added a touch of whimsy to the artwork.
meanings.sent4: Through facetting, the artist revealed the true depth of the portrait.
meanings.sent5: The facetting of the music highlighted the beauty of each instrument.
